question: I have type 2 diabetes.  Every six months my doctor tests me for protein in my urine.  The last two times the tests came back positive and he diagnosed me with microalbuminuria.  But I had UTI's both of those times and a friend who is a nurse said a patient should never be tested for urine protein when battling a UTI.  Is this true?  What effect does a UTI have on the test?
title: Was this diagnosis of microalbuminuria a false positive?
